header.title: Welcome,
text: I'm Blake, and this is my portfolio showcasing my skills and projects as I pursue a career in software engineering.
On this site, you can explore the projects I've completed, or read a bit about me.

contact.shortSummary: Blake is a recent graduate from Boston College with a double major in computer science and neuroscience.

paragraphs.title: About This Site
paragraphs.content: This site was developed using React and Vite for a modern, fast development experience. React Router DOM enables seamless navigation between pages, while dynamic page generation is powered by a JSON file that allows for easy content updates. The website is also designed using grid, allowing for easy reformatting for anyone who may be viewing on a mobile device. Currently hosted on GitHub, the site features a custom logo.

paragraphs.title: Future Plans for the Site
paragraphs.content: In the future, I plan to host my personal website locally using a Linux server via Ubuntu Server. This approach will give me more control over the environment and the opportunity to fine-tune performance and security settings. I am considering several hosting frameworks, including Nginx for its high performance and stability, Apache for its versatility and robust feature set, and Docker for containerization, which would allow for easy deployment. These tools will enable me to maintain a highly efficient and reliable website. By hosting locally, I aim to provide a seamless and professional experience for visitors, eliminating the lack of browser routing on github pages, and further demonstrating my technical expertise and commitment to quality.

about.name: Blake Prall
about.selfSummary:
I am a recent graduate from Boston College with a double major in Computer Science and Neuroscience. Originating from Cottage Grove, Minnesota, my academic journey has been characterized by a passion for exploring the limitless potential of technology. My dual major in neuroscience and computer science reflects my interdisciplinary approach, where I've leveraged computational methods to solve complex problems and drive innovation.

Throughout my studies, I've developed robust skills in research, problem-solving, and software development, preparing me to thrive in a dynamic software engineering environment. I am eager to contribute my technical expertise and enthusiasm for innovation to your team, delivering impactful solutions and advancing technology to new heights.

moreDetails.title: Educational Journey
moreDetails.content: I pursued a double major in neuroscience and computer science, a challenging yet rewarding path that honed my analytical and technical skills. Balancing my studies with part-time work to cover groceries was tough, but it taught me resilience and time management. Despite the demanding schedule, I remained committed to my education, engaging in various projects and research that deepened my understanding of both fields. My coursework in neuroscience provided me with a solid foundation in understanding complex biological systems, while my computer science studies equipped me with the technical expertise to develop innovative solutions. This unique combination of disciplines has given me a broad perspective and the ability to approach problems from multiple angles.

moreDetails.title: Work Experience
moreDetails.content: During the summers, I worked in construction, a fast-paced and physically demanding environment. This experience required me to learn quickly and adapt to new challenges on the fly. It significantly improved my communication skills as I collaborated with diverse teams to complete projects efficiently. The hands-on nature of the job also instilled a strong work ethic and problem-solving abilities that I carry with me today. Working in construction taught me the importance of precision and attention to detail, as even small mistakes could have significant consequences. It also provided me with a sense of accomplishment, knowing that my efforts contributed to the creation of tangible structures.

moreDetails.title: Personal Growth
moreDetails.content: There was a period of uncertainty in my life when I wasn't sure what career path to pursue, which led me to forgo internships. This phase, however, was crucial for my personal growth. It allowed me to explore different interests and ultimately helped me realize my passion for technology and problem-solving. These experiences have shaped my approach to challenges and my determination to succeed in my chosen field. I learned the value of perseverance and the importance of staying open to new opportunities. This period of self-discovery also taught me to trust my instincts and follow my passions, even when the path ahead is not always clear.

moreDetails.title: Future Aspirations
moreDetails.content: Looking ahead, I am excited about the possibilities in the tech industry. My goal is to leverage my background in neuroscience and computer science to develop innovative solutions that can make a meaningful impact. I am particularly interested in areas such as artificial intelligence and data science. I am eager to continue learning and growing, and I look forward to contributing to projects that push the boundaries of technology. I am passionate about using technology to solve real-world problems and improve people's lives. Whether it's developing new algorithms to analyze complex data or creating applications that enhance user experiences, I am committed to making a positive difference through my work.

projects.title: Personal Website Development
projects.description: personal website portfolio web development TypeScript TSX React Node.js React Router DOM Vite Firebase dynamic content real-time updates responsive design CSS Grid off-canvas navbar global search functionality versatile search JSON file content management security user authentication login scalable solution user experience web application professional experience technical expertise My personal website based in React. html css typescript javascript website portfolio personal react reactjs react.js vite json node nodejs node.js dynamic content loading React Router DOM dynamic page generation grid flex offcanvas custom logo
projects.frontPageDesc: My personal website developed with React and Vite.
projects.contents:
For my portfolio, I developed a comprehensive personal website that serves as a central hub for information about my professional journey in software engineering. This project, which you are currently navigating, showcases my skills in web development and my ability to create dynamic, user-friendly interfaces. The website is built using a robust tech stack that includes TypeScript (TSX), React, Node.js, React Router DOM, Vite, and Firebase. Each of these technologies plays a crucial role in ensuring the site is both functional and efficient.
 One of the standout features of this website is its dynamic content rewriting capability. This means that the content on the site can be updated in real-time without requiring a full page reload, providing a seamless user experience. Additionally, the website is designed to be fully responsive, automatically adjusting its layout based on the screen size of the device being used. This is achieved through the use of CSS Grid, which allows for flexible and adaptive page layouts. For mobile users, I have implemented an offcanvas navbar that provides easy navigation without taking up valuable screen space.
 The website also includes a powerful global search functionality. This feature allows users to quickly find the information they are looking for by actively showing matches to their search queries and routing them to the relevant pages. The search bar is highly versatile, enabling users to search for specific content on individual pages through a dropdown menu. This ensures that all the information on the site is easily accessible and searchable.
 One of the key aspects of this project is its ease of content management. Almost all the content on the site, including news, projects, about me, the home page, and contact information, can be updated simply by modifying a JSON file. This not only makes the site highly maintainable but also ensures that new data is immediately searchable through the global search bar. This level of flexibility is particularly beneficial for keeping the site up-to-date with minimal effort.
 In terms of security and user authentication, I have integrated Firebase for login functionality. This allows users to securely log in to view the source code and other restricted content. Firebase provides a reliable and scalable solution for managing user authentication, ensuring that only authorized users have access to sensitive information.
 Overall, this personal website project is a testament to my skills in modern web development. It combines a range of advanced features and technologies to create a site that is not only visually appealing but also highly functional and user-friendly. By leveraging tools like React, Node.js, and Firebase, I have been able to build a platform that effectively showcases my professional experience and technical expertise. This project highlights my ability to design and implement complex web applications, making it a valuable addition to my portfolio.

projects.title: Simple Shell Command Interpreter
projects.description: shell command interpreter C programming fork execvp POSIX-compatible input redirection output redirection append redirection error handling interactive prompt command execution file operations system calls command parsing input handling output management user interaction
projects.frontPageDesc: A ruidmentary command interpreter written in C.
projects.contents:
The Simple Shell Command Interpreter is a C-based project designed to mimic basic shell functionalities. It can execute commands, handle input and output redirection, and manage errors effectively. The project showcases fundamental shell features and system programming skills.
 To start, the interpreter prompts users with a `cssh$ ` command line, allowing them to enter various commands. It supports input redirection with `<`, output redirection with `>`, and output append redirection with `>>`. The shell continuously processes commands until the user types `exit`.
 The core of the project involves using system calls such as `fork` for process creation and `execvp` for executing commands. Redirections are handled by manipulating file descriptors with `dup2`, ensuring that input and output are correctly redirected according to user commands.
 The shell includes basic error handling to manage common issues, such as incorrect usage of redirection operators or file access problems. This functionality is crucial for ensuring the interpreter behaves reliably under various conditions.
 Developing this shell provided valuable experience in system programming, command execution, and error handling. It highlights the power of C and POSIX systems for creating interactive applications and understanding low-level operations.
 Overall, this project exemplifies how a simple yet effective shell can be built using fundamental programming concepts and system calls, offering insights into the workings of command-line interfaces and process management.

projects.title: Full Stack Budgeting App
projects.description: budgeting app financial tool React TypeScript TSX D3 interactive charts Firebase user authentication Firestore NoSQL database real-time synchronization data storage user interface budget tracking expense categorization financial goals user empowerment personal finance management web development security modular codebase dynamic charts collaborative development user experience financial insights Web application for budgeting built with React & D3. d3 d3.js d3js firebase firestore login signup google signup html css typescript javascript website portfolio personal react reactjs react.js vite json node nodejs node.js dynamic content loading React Router DOM dynamic page generation flex custom logo
projects.frontPageDesc: Web application for budgeting built with React & D3.
projects.contents:
Introducing Distant Dollar, a budgeting application meticulously crafted by the collaborative efforts of Blake Prall and Dylan Leddy. This groundbreaking financial tool is a testament to the prowess of modern web development, employing a robust technology stack to deliver a seamless and secure budgeting experience. The utilization of React and TypeScript (TSX) ensures a modular and maintainable codebase, while D3 brings dynamic and interactive charts to the forefront, providing users with visually compelling insights into their financial data.
 Security is paramount in Distant Dollar, and this is exemplified by the integration of Firebase for user authentication. Users can trust in the app's commitment to safeguarding their financial information, thanks to Firebase's proven authentication mechanisms. Furthermore, Firestore, a NoSQL cloud database, underpins Distant Dollar's data storage and retrieval, ensuring real-time synchronization and accessibility across devices.
 The user-centric design of Distant Dollar sets it apart with an intuitive interface that allows users to effortlessly navigate through the app. Budget tracking becomes a breeze, with users empowered to set budgets for various categories and receive real-time updates on their spending patterns. The application's ability to categorize expenses and provide detailed breakdowns aids in identifying potential savings areas and optimizing financial decisions.
 Blake Prall and Dylan Leddy's commitment to user empowerment is further reflected in Distant Dollar's goal-setting feature. Users can set and pursue financial goals, with the app offering actionable insights to facilitate their journey. As individuals engage with the app's seamless interface, powerful features, and robust security measures, Distant Dollar is poised to redefine the landscape of personal finance management. The collaboration between Prall and Leddy has resulted in a groundbreaking application that stands at the intersection of innovation and financial well-being.

projects.title: DNS Server
projects.description: DNS server Java caching recursive queries zone files TTL query handling response forwarding upstream servers request forwarding DNS records customizable zone file caching mechanism server configuration server setup query resolution network communication DNS message parsing DNS record definition DNS caching Java Instant class request handling DNS zone management build script Makefile example zone file DNS server class HTTP server response output dig command testing network protocols DNS query response handling server-side scripting caching records TTL management DNS query forwarding DNS server files java dig routing ip ipv4 Basic Java-based DNS server handling recursive queries and caching.
projects.frontPageDesc: Java-based DNS server handling recursive queries and caching.
projects.contents:
The Basic DNS Server project highlights a foundational DNS server written in Java. This implementation focuses on critical DNS operations, including caching mechanisms to enhance performance and recursive query handling to resolve domain names efficiently. It provides insight into the DNS resolution process and demonstrates key concepts of DNS protocol and server management.
 The project includes detailed documentation and code examples to facilitate understanding of DNS server functionality. With features such as caching to reduce query response times and recursive queries for resolving domain names, the Basic DNS Server serves as an educational tool for those interested in network programming and DNS infrastructure.
 Designed for both beginners and experienced developers, the Basic DNS Server project offers a comprehensive introduction to DNS server mechanics and serves as a stepping stone for more advanced network programming endeavors. Its clear implementation and focus on core DNS concepts make it an excellent resource for learning and experimentation.

projects.title: Basic HTTP Server
projects.description: Basic Java-based HTTP server handling GET requests. HTTP server GET requests web server routing request handling response handling server-side programming REST API URL endpoints request parsing response formatting status codes request headers response headers server configuration middleware logging error handling server-side scripting protocols TCP/IP sockets HTTP methods request handling routing framework lightweight server request processing response generation server logic concurrency threading asynchronous processing network communication error handling request validation server response headers HTTP status codes network protocols server architecture
projects.frontPageDesc: Basic Java-based HTTP server handling GET requests.
projects.contents:
The Basic HTTP Server project showcases a rudimentary yet functional HTTP server written in Java. This implementation emphasizes the fundamental aspects of HTTP communication, including handling client requests, parsing headers, and sending appropriate responses. The server is designed to support the delivery of static content and serves as a practical example for understanding how web servers operate at a basic level.
 The project includes features such as simple routing mechanisms and response handling for different types of HTTP requests. It serves as a hands-on learning tool for those interested in web server internals and provides a foundation for further exploration into more advanced server functionalities and optimizations.
 With clear code examples and thorough documentation, the Basic HTTP Server project aims to provide educational value and a starting point for developers looking to delve into server-side programming. The project's simplicity and focus on core concepts make it an excellent resource for both beginners and those seeking to refresh their understanding of HTTP server development.

projects.frontPageDesc: Mobile game emulator made with a Raspberry Pi.
projects.contents:
Creating a mobile game emulator using a Raspberry Pi was a project I undertook just for fun. The idea of being able to transform a small, affordable computer like the Raspberry Pi into a mobile platform that could play classic games sounded awesome. It was a challenging yet rewarding journey that allowed me to explore my passion for both gaming and tinkering with technology.
 The first step in this endeavor was selecting the right Raspberry Pi model and gathering the necessary components. After some research, I settled on the Raspberry Pi 4 for its improved processing power and versatility. Then, I acquired a high-quality microSD card to store the emulator software and game ROMs and a power supply.
 But I didn't stop there; I wanted to take this project to the next level. Inspired by a desire to make the gaming experience more immersive and portable, I decided to 3D print a custom game case. I designed a compact case that perfectly accommodated the Raspberry Pi, microSD card, and power supply. The case was not only functional but also aesthetically pleasing, reminiscent of a handheld gaming device (despite not having on-board controls).
 The real magic happened when I integrated a small LED screen into the design. The LED screen was strategically placed on the top cover of the case, allowing for a visual display of the games. To power the whole setup, I added a set of rechargeable batteries inside the case. The result was a self-contained, portable gaming device, complete with a screen and battery pack.
 Seeing the LED screen light up with the games and feeling the weight of the 3D-printed game case in my hands was a truly gratifying moment. I had transformed a simple Raspberry Pi into a handheld gaming emulator that could be taken anywhere, untethered from power sources. Navigating through game menus, selecting titles, and experiencing the nostalgia of classic games on a self-created device was a unique and immensely satisfying experience.
 In the end, this fun project was a testament to the versatility and creativity that the Raspberry Pi encourages. It allowed me to indulge in my passion for gaming, explore the world of emulation, and discover the potential of a tiny, affordable computer like the Raspberry Pi. It was not just about recreating games; it was about reliving childhood memories and learning new skills along the way. This project stands as a reminder that, in the world of technology and tinkering, even the most whimsical ideas can lead to rewarding and enjoyable experiences, while simultaneously showcasing the power of 3D printing and creative problem-solving.
